text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with clams casino one of my
all-time favorite seafood appetizers I
mean come on any recipe that has butter
and bacon it's got to be awesome
alright so I have a dozen Little Neck
clams which is my favorite variety to
use for this by the way seafood times
very underrated newspaper great sports
section so I put my clams in a Dutch
oven and I put it on high heat and when
I thought it was hot
you know a couple minutes I threw in
some water covered it and I steamed
these for just about five minutes just
until they opened you want to keep them
plump not chewy and shriveled up so as
soon as they open take them out let them
cool prep your other stuff which is
bacon so I have two strips of bacon that
I'm going to cut in six pieces each
because I need 12 pieces of bacon see
how you did the math there in a small
saute pan and about a tablespoon of
butter you're going to cook your bacon
and you know what I could watch that all
day you're going to cook your bacon not
quite crisp almost so it's cooked but
it's not crunchy take it out put in some
diced red bell pepper finely diced cook
that for about two minutes just to
soften it a little bit then you're going
to add two cloves of finely minced
garlic and this is the only way to screw
up this dish burn the garlic so don't
burn the garlic you're just going to
give it about 30 seconds 40 seconds then
turn off the heat throw it in a mixing
bowl we're going to add our breadcrumbs
just plain breadcrumbs some fresh ground
black pepper a pinch of salt a couple
drips of Worcestershire sauce and then
we're going to mix that up
the last ingredient and sacrilege to
some that I don't care about a
tablespoon of finely grated Reggiano
parmesan and that really kind of the
glue that holds all this together when
the clams are cool enough to handle
you're going to pull off one side of the
shell and I you know try to use the
bigger half of the shell the deeper half
I like to loosen the clam from the shell
so it's easier to eat and I flip it over
I don't know why looks cooler
all right topic clams with your
breadcrumb mixture and then each one
gets topped with one of those pieces of
reserved bacon how awesome does that
look alright then traditionally this is
cooked on rock salt any supermarket has
it's very cheap all right so I'm going
to fill up my little heat proof dish
there Nestle my clams into the salt and
then I'm going to broil that under a
high broiler what is that about I don't
know eight ten inches away and that took
about six minutes until the bread crumbs
were browned the bacon was crisp edged
and bubbling you top it with fresh
parsley you drizzle it with fresh lemon
juice and you eat it and it's an
unbelievable food experience garlic
butter bacon and clams come on anyway
all the ingredients are on the site so
go check it out and as always enjoy
